    • Constructor Detail

      • MovinBeaconScanner

        public MovinBeaconScanner(MovinProximityEngine proximityEngine,
                          android.content.Context context)
        Creates a new MovinBeaconScanner.
        Parameters:
        proximityEngine - The MovinProximityEngine which is responsible for delivering beacon events

    • Method Detail

      • addMap

        public void addMap(MovinMap map,
                   SuccessListener listener)
        Adds a map to the MovinBeaconScanner to scan for. The beacons found in the MovinMap will automatically be connected to the ranged beacons.
        Parameters:
        map - The MovinMap of which the beacons should be scanned for
        listener - Optionally a listener that will be informed if the beacons of the map were succesfully added or not.

      • removeMap

        public void removeMap(MovinMap map)
        Removes a map from the MovinBeaconScanner. The beacons found in the MovinMap will no longer be automatically connected to the ranged beacons
        Parameters:
        map - The MovinMap of which the beacons no longer should be scanned for

      • containsMap

        public boolean containsMap(MovinMap map)
        Checks if the given map is already being scanned for
        Parameters:
        map -
        Returns:

      • getMaps

        public java.util.List<MovinMap> getMaps()
        Returns a list of maps for which this MovinBeaconScanner is scanning the beacons for.
        Returns:

      • started

        public boolean started()
        Returns whether or not the MovinBeaconScanner is started or not at all
        Returns:

      • started

        public boolean started(MovinBeaconScannerListener listener)
        Returns whether or not the MovinBeaconScanner is started or not for the given listener
        Parameters:
        listener -
        Returns:

      • start

        public void start(MovinBeaconScannerListener listener)
        Starts the MovinBeaconScanner and calls the given listener. Only the first time this method is called the scanner will actually start, all subsequent calls will only add the listener
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener that will receive the events

      • stop

        public void stop(MovinBeaconScannerListener listener)
        Stops the MovinBeaconScanner for the given listener. Only when there are no more listeners th is method will actually stop the scanner, otherwise only the listener is removed
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener that no longer will receive events

      • addSilentListener

        public void addSilentListener(MovinBeaconScannerListener listener)
        Adds a silent listener to which the events will be passed to. Adding such a listener will not affect whether or not the MovinBeaconScanner starts or stops
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener to add

      • removeSilentListener

        public void removeSilentListener(MovinBeaconScannerListener listener)
        Removes a silent listener. Removing such a listener will not affect whether or not the MovinBeaconScanner starts or stops
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener to remove

      • onStop

        public void onStop()
        Called when the MovinBeaconScanner should stop. Will only be called when there are no more listeners, or when the MovinSDK is deinitialized / resetted. Should not be called by anyone other than the SDK itself.

      • onGetData

        public void onGetData(java.util.List<MovinScanResult> data,
                      java.lang.Exception exception)
        Description copied from interface: GetDataListener
        Called when the data is obtained or if an exception occurred
        Specified by:
        onGetData in interface GetDataListener<java.util.List<MovinScanResult>>
        Parameters:
        data - The data that is obtained, or null if an exception occurred.
        exception - If an exception occurred, this value shows what error occurred. If no exception has been thrown, this property is null.
